gurmukhi: jtI dMf muMfI qpI bHmcwrI ]jtI jMgmI jwmnI jMqR DwrI ]
translation: There were also there mighty warriors living on mountains and other countries; the mighty ones of Balkh, Bengal, Russia and Ruhekhand were also there, in his shelter.131.

gurmukhi: prI pwrbqI prm dysI pCyly ]blI bwlKI bMg rUmI rhyly ]131]
translation: The saints with matted locks, the deceptors, deceiving people through Yantras and Mantras, the residents of Aj Pradesh and Aabhir Desh and the Yogis performing Neoli Karma (purging of intestines) were also there;

gurmukhi: jtI jwmnI jMqR DwrI Clwry ]AjI AwmrI invlkw krm vwry ]
translation: The Atev Agnihotris, controlling the world and the perfect celibates adopting celibacy at all levels were also in his refuge.132.

gurmukhi: AqyvwgnhoqRI juAw jgX DwrI ]ADM aUrDry qy brM bHmcwrI ]132]
transliteration: Atebaagadhotrijuaa Jagya Dhdaree|| Adhan Oorddare Te Baran Brahmchdaree||132||
translation: All Atev Agnihotris, controlling the world and the perfect celibates adopting celibacy at all levels were also in his refuge.132.

gurmukhi: ijqy dys dysM hqy CqRDwrI ]sBY pwn lwgY qjXo grb BwrI ]
transliteration: Jite Des Desan Hate Chhatradhdaree|| Sabhai Paan Laagad Tajyo Gadab Bhdaree||
translation: All the canopied kings of far and near, they all fell at his feet, leaving their pride;

gurmukhi: krYN lwg srbM su sMnXws jogM ]iehI pMQ lwgy suBM srb logM ]133]
transliteration: Darain Laag Saraban Su Sannyaas Jouang|| Ehipanth Laage Soubhan Sarab Logadg||133||
translation: They all practiced Sannyas and Yoga and al of them became followers of this path.133.

gurmukhi: sBy dys dyswn qy log Awey ]krM d`q ky Awn mUMf muMfwey ]
transliteration: Sabhe Des Desaan Te Log Aae|| Karan Datt Ke Aan Moond Mounndaae||
translation: The people of various countries from far and near, came and got performed the tonsure ceremony from the hands of Dutt,

gurmukhi: Dry sIs pY prm jUtM jtwnM ]krY lwig sMnXws jog A`pRmwnM ]134]
transliteration: Ddare Sees Pae Param Jeetan Jataanan|| Darai Laag(i) Saaanyaas Jog Appramaanan||134||
translation: And many people wearing matted locks on their head, practiced Yoga and Sannyas.134.

gurmukhi: dys dysn ky sBY niRp Awn kY iqh Taur ]jwn pwn prY sBY gurd`q sRI srmaur ]
transliteration: Des Desan Ke Sabhai Nrip Aan Kai Tih Thaur|| Jaan Paan Darai Sabhai Gurdatt Srisarmaur||
translation: The kings of various countries from far and near fell at the feet of the supreme Guru Dutt at that place;

gurmukhi: iqAwg Aaur ney ney miq eykhI miq Twn ]Awn mUMf muMfwq By sB rwj pwt inDwn ]135]
transliteration: Tiaag Aur Nae Nae Mat(i) Ek-himat(i) Thaan|| Aan Maann Mounndaat Bhe Sabhraaj Paat Nidhaan||135||
translation: They all abandoned the new sects and joined the one sect of Yoga; they abandoned their royal responsibilities and came to get done their tonsure ceremony.135.

gurmukhi: Awn Awn lgy sBY pg jwn kY gur dyv ]SsqR SwsqR sBY BiRqwNbr AnMq rUp AByv ]
transliteration: Aan Aan Lage Sabhai Pag Jaan Kai Gur Dev|| Shastra Shaastra Sabhai Bhritaanbar Anant|| Roop Abhev||
translation: All of them, considering him as the Supreme Guru, came to bow at his feet and Dutt was also the great purusha comprehending the secret of weapons and Shastras;

gurmukhi: AiC`d gwq AiC`j rUp AiB`d jog durMq ]Aimq au`jl Aijq prm aupijE su d`q mhMq ]136]
transliteration: Achhidd Gadt Achhijj Roop Abhidd Jog Durant|| Amit Ujjal Ahit Param Oupjio Su Datt Mahant||136||
translation: His body was invincible, the form indestructible and he had achieved oneness in Yoga; he has manifested himself in the form of unlimited, lustrous and unconquerable power.136.

gurmukhi: pyK rUp cky crwcr srb bXom ibmwn ]j`qR q`qR rhy inrwDp icqR rUp smwn ]
transliteration: Pekh Roop Chake Charaachar Sarab Byom Bimaan|| Jattra Tattra Rahe Niraadhap Chitra Roop Samaan||
translation: The animate and inanimate creation and the gods of heaven, were wonder-struck on seeing his figure and the kings looked splendid like the pretty portraits here and there;
